name: Not Boring Movies
desc:
X city opened a new cinema, many people would like to go to this cinema.
The cinema also gives out a poster indicating the moviesâ€™ ratings and descriptions. 
 
Please write a SQL query to output movies with an odd numbered ID and a description that is not 'boring'. Order the result by rating.


For example, table cinema:

+---------+-----------+--------------+-----------+
|   id    | movie     |  description |  rating   |
+---------+-----------+--------------+-----------+
|   1     | War       |   great 3D   |   8.9     |
|   2     | Science   |   fiction    |   8.5     |
|   3     | irish     |   boring     |   6.2     |
|   4     | Ice song  |   Fantacy    |   8.6     |
|   5     | House card|   Interesting|   9.1     |
+---------+-----------+--------------+-----------+

For the example above, the output should be:

+---------+-----------+--------------+-----------+
|   id    | movie     |  description |  rating   |
+---------+-----------+--------------+-----------+
|   5     | House card|   Interesting|   9.1     |
|   1     | War       |   great 3D   |   8.9     |
+---------+-----------+--------------+-----------+

templates.defaultCode: # Write your MySQL query statement below

mysql: Create table If Not Exists cinema (id int, movie varchar(255), description varchar(255), rating float(2, 1))
